byline.contributor: Benoît Morenne contributed reporting from Paris, and Lilia Blaise from Nice, France.

abstract: Authorities say Nice, France, truck attacker Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel planned terrorist act that killed 84 people for months; no evidence has emerged linking assailant with Islamic State, contrary to militant group's claims.
lead_paragraph: There was no evidence that Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who killed 84 people on Bastille Day, had direct contact with the Islamic State.

headline.main: Attacker in Nice Plotted for Months and Had Accomplices, French Prosecutor Says
headline.print_headline: Attacker in Nice Plotted for Months and Had Accomplices, Prosecutor Says

snippet: There was no evidence that Mohamed Lahouaiej Bouhlel, who killed 84 people on Bastille Day, had direct contact with the Islamic State....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
